title: [SUGGESTION] Weighted Boots
body:
-30% effectiveness for knock ups and displacements
+X Movement Speed
+15 Magic Resist
+15 Armor

---------------------------------------------------
Why? There are no counters for knock backs or displacements.

I feel like this would be more of a niche item geared towards tanks. 

Since they are "weighted" I think they should be the slowest of all the boots.
-----------------------------------------------
EDIT: The numbers should probably be adjusted for balancing. These were just some rough numbers I came up with. 
--------------------------

EDIT2: Another possible way of implementing this type of "tenacity" could be in a different item.

Would look something like this:

HEAVY PLATE:
-20% effectiveness for knock up and displacements
30 armor
30 magic resist

Builds from chainmail and negatron cloak.

replies.body: I think having it be both defensive values, while also granting you that kind of CC reduction would probably make these a bit too potent. I think they would need stats that are a bit more niche.
Could also get rid of the stats all together and make it similar to swifties.

No, with the drawback of not being as fast as other boots, it would definitely need something to give it some desirability over other boots. Knock up resistance isn't going to cut it. I just don't know what would work best.
Well, considering that something like 70% of hard cc in the game is displacement based, I'd say it already is fairly desirable.

47% of all champions have 1 ability with some kind of hard CC that can't be reduced by tenacity, but those include champions such as Trundle and Anivia who displace you for like 0,01 seconds with their terrain and pulls that wouldn't make any sense to be shortened either. Most are knockbacks, I believe.
57% of all champions have at least 1 ability with some kind of hard CC that can be reduced by tenacity. Most are stuns.

If you count actual abilities, it's probably 40-50% displacements at most.

Like 

+100 hp?

or +% max health?
Your suggestions make it even MORE universally coveted. Everyone can use HP.

not everyone can use small % max health / % bonus health.

not everyone can use % armor / % bonus armor.

> [{quoted}](name=Super Cow Swag,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uBo2aeFE,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2019-04-29T16:22:27.715+0000)
>
> not everyone can use small % max health / % bonus health.
> 
> not everyone can use % armor / % bonus armor.

Literally everyone can use %Max HP. Except maybe Pyke, but then he at least gets some attack out of it. There's not a single champion in this game that would not welcome having more HP to give them more durability in battle.
Same goes true for %MR/AR. That little bit of armor from your base stats can go a long way with boosts boosting them by a percent. Plus, most characters will build some minor form of defenses, be it a Zhonya's or Abyssal Sceptor, or Guardian Angel, so it would only make those items that much more potent.

%Bonus HP/AR/MR does get more niche, yes, and fewer champions will be able to utilize them to their fullest, making it mostly a tank item. I would believe that blanket defensive stats for a pair of boots are not the direction to go in this scenario.

Literally everyone can use armor and mr from tabi and merc treads?  Infact non mages tend to LOVE merc and tabiâ€¦

Are you saying we should change merc and tabi to be more niche aswell?

And you cant get anymore niche in favor of tanks than % max health or % bonus health when it comes to defensive stats....Squishy champions definitely do not benefit as much unless they are building against a mixed comp and need a defensive item or two in order to survive.

Oh no zed got +50 hp because he built {{item:3071}} with his weighted boots.
Actually %bonus hp is just as good on squishies as it is on tanks. 5% more durability is 5% more durability.
But if a tank is 4500 in terms of durable and an adc only 1600 that 5% is 225 on the tank and only 80 on the adc.
By but 225 is still 5% of the tank's HP while 80 is 5% of the adc's HP. Both are getting 5% more durable. They get the same relative boost, because it's a percentage.

I don't think you understand what %bonus hp is....

a squishy would have to buy items/runes with hp on them in order to use %bonus hp at all..

%bonus hp does not scale with base hp.

By % bonus HP I mean a bonus to HP that is a percentage of your HP. Since it's a percentage, it gives everyone the same relative increase to durability. For comparison, a flat 500 HP is much more valuable on someone with only 1500 HP than someone with 4500 HP.

I said % bonus hp and then YOU REPLIED TO ME using the % bonus hp term...telling me that % bonus health is just as good on squishies as it is on tanks YOU ARE TAKING THE TERM I USED AND REPEATING IT, don't tell me what you mean was something different from what I mean....

%bonus health gives you health based on your items + runes + buffs....

Meaning a squishy champ would need items and runes and buffs built towards flat hp in order to benefit from it...

No, it isn't. The only exception for this, is if you factor in resistances, like Armor and Magic Resist or any other extraneous variable.

500 HP is 500 HP, It won't take the enemy Zed any longer to kill that new 500 HP whether it's on the enemy Sivir or the Mundo. Comparatively? Sure, it would be better on the ADC Sivir, but from a mathematical point of view, unless the damage being done to you, **IS ALSO A PERCENTAGE **, they benefit exactly the same.

to be fair, on any item other then boots you'd be 100% right. It's a little more difficult to predict how this would compete when the only things it has to overpower to become a problem are other boots.
Mages and ADCs would never build this over damage items, but it's harder to tell whether they'd build it over their boots.
Still think it'd be kind of a bonus to the game, maybe Tanks could use a boot item to build when mercs aren't mandatory.

Giving both would make it less beneficial to rush if it has the right price.{{item:3047}} {{item:3111}} already fill the niche of countering one type of Damage significantly, while Weighted Boots gives a reasonable amount lower than them for a niche effect.

And based on what OP said, it will be a slower tier in movement Speed than the other 2 and Movement Speed is a really powerful stat, especially for Tanks that don't really have any access to it ({{item:3742}} and Boots) and already have really low bases (most from 325 to 340, same MS as Ranged champs without any items).

Yes, but you have to not only look at this from a tank perspective, but a mage, bruiser, diver, ADC, and every other class perspective as well. Tanks might not benefit as much, but mages or ADCs can especially benefit from the extra defensive stats that they wouldn't normal be able to access all neatly wrapped in their boots item.

Good point. I think it all depends on the difference in Movement Speed between the Weighted Boots and normal tier 2 Boots. Mages and ADC have already a lower Base MS from most other classes, making them easier to engage and chase. 

Same for Bruisers and Divers, only the opposite event: it is easier to disengage and run away from them or kite. It all boils down to numbers, but the idea of an item that gives both Armor and Mr isn't that bad. Maybe the numbers should be lowered a bit, but currently it isn't that amazing when you compare it to Merc Treads or Ninja Tabi.

Can't happen.  They use knock ups and displacements in certain instances BECAUSE of the guaranteed CC duration.  The time the enemy spends in the air is directly tied to things like how long that champion takes to close the gap, use their ultimate, or follow up on a combo.

If you changed that it would screw up dozens of champion timings all across League.

> [{quoted}](name=y0r1ck,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uBo2aeFE,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2019-04-29T19:18:32.753+0000)
>
> Can you give some specific examples? I can't think of any, but your point makes sense and I think some specific examples would be good for the discussion.

Well for one Cho'gath Q.  If he is trying to catch someone for an engage and that is his main source of CC until he walks right on top of someone, and then the knock up only lasts like .2 sec, he becomes completely useless.

Also, stops Yasuo from being able to use R because it doesn't activate until after the opponent is in the air.

Swains passive pull would end early because it is considered a knock up.  Nunu (which gets the knock up extended by how far you travel with the W) works that way because otherwise he would have too much CC point blank, but when he uses it to engage he ends the W the snowball distance away from the enemy and has to walk to them to use E and R.  Same thing there, if it ended early, and he couldn't go after them he would have no engage and no ability to follow up.

There are a lot more, but there's a couple of good ones.

> [{quoted}](name=Velasan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uBo2aeFE,comment-id=000900000000,timestamp=2019-04-29T19:38:06.427+0000)

> Also, stops Yasuo from being able to use R because it doesn't activate until after the opponent is in the air.

I support this item SOLELY for this reason right here.  I also know it would not get implemented SOLELY for this reason right here.
Well at least you're self aware.
1 champion shouldn't impede the greater health of the game

What greater health of the game? The ability to reduce CC duration for a Crowd control specifically designed around being unreduce-able, and hence, already has a lower duration than most stuns or snares? Did you even read Velassen's superb comment about why knock-ups are used as opposed to regular CC? 

And this ain't even getting into the absolute Wooooossh from Heero's joke.

We should also have boots that reduce the unreaduce-able True Damage.
We'll call them "Not (!) Boots" or "Just Gloves".

> Also, stops Yasuo from being able to use R because it doesn't activate until after the opponent is in the air.

This makes no sense. Yasuo's R doesnt need the target enemy to be in the air for every long for it to be activated.
Yas can trigger his R off of knockup's as short as Sejuani's Q, Swain's passive pull, Aatrox sweet spot q. Even enemies displaced by Anivia's W or Yorick's W are vulnerable to it **if** the Yasuo is able to time it and react fast enough!
It only requires the target to be in the air for an _instant_. Yes the Yasuo needs to be a little faster, but it would in no way stop him from using his ult completely.

I agree that there needs to be some kind of item to counter knock ups since itâ€™s the only displacement without something to reduce its duration and itâ€™s very common. The only problem is finding out the numbers. I think weighted boots is a good idea, just depends on its numbers.

The lack of a counter is the point. 
Riot's introduced knockups on every new champion while simultaneously removing every source of tenacity to ensure CC lasts as long as they want it to and pro play cant just cleanse everything and avoid #LECBIGPLAYS 

Also Yasuo R
Yasuo R is a suspension and the cc portion of it can be QSSed, by the way.

Maybe this shit could be a keystone?

We DEFINITELY need some sort of knock-up counter at this point, there are WAY too many types of knocks in League

i think a better Weighted Boots should be this:

Iron Boots

immune to displacements (but not CC)

-50% movement (-25% movement if built from {{item:2422}} )

+25 armor.

you gain full immunity to displacements at the cost of being slow as hell. because why would a tank need to be fast? yes it will make getting back into the action allot harder but chances are a top lane tank will have teleport. and they also gain movement from other items. so by building say {{item:3142}} that'll reduce the slow down by 40% leaving only a -10% slow down. and of course being made of iron it needs to add defense.
This would end up hard countering some kits though. Yasuo straight up wouldnâ€™t be able to ult anyone with them.
his ult is the only one that requires a requirement to use. everyone else can use their ult any time they want. so that more his problem than the item.

> [{quoted}](name=Inkling Commando,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uBo2aeFE,comment-id=001400000000,timestamp=2019-04-29T22:54:22.772+0000)

Like, yeah youâ€™re slow, but the benefit is huge to hard counter. Yeah, Yasuo will have a problem since he requires a knockup to ult, but so many other kits will be destroyed because of it.

I like the idea of Weighted Boots; maybe instead of being its own separate set though, it could be a "modification" to current boots? Like, for example, it could be like old boot enchantments(RIP these). It would build out of tier 2 boots and therefore give all of the stats of its predecessor... but lose a certain, indeterminant amount of MS as a result in exchange for the knock up/displacement reduction.

In all honesty this would be best case scenario but I don't think we will ever see T3 boots again.
Problem is, if you implement only one type of T3 boots, it will result in everyone getting that T3 anway. It should be limited to Mercurys and Ninja Tabis only.
Or they could provide other t3 boots. I dont think it should be limited. Its frustrating as is that they limit things between ranged and melee champions. T3 boots should not be limited

I know. :c I'm still really sad. I miss being able to get the red enchant on ADCs.

That said, if they were to add something like this into the game, this feels like the fairest and cleanest and easiest way to do it; it would be as simple as tying their effectiveness against knock up/displacements to the amount of MS you would lose off your given boot. This would make pairing it with Mobis and Swifties kind of bad but that would be fine honestly.

> Why? There are no counters for knock backs or displacements.

No, there's no counter*building* for Knockbacks, Displacements or knock ups. There is counterplay, typically, to most abilities that have knock ups or displacement. Some less, some more, but they still have counterplay. That's not even mentioning the fact that a majority of knock ups themselves, already have less duration than most stuns or snares.

Don't worry; no matter how many upvotes this gets, it'll never be implemented, because it misunderstands knockups' lack of interaction with Tenacity as a problem rather than a solution.

I think knock ups or displacements don't have counters because Riot sees that as CC that should work no matter what. These rioter  [comment](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-plus/2MKjsKEj-general-discussion-of-knock-ups-vs-stuns?comment=0017) explains this thoughs on CC. Their stance might have changed on it though since its 8 months old
It would be interesting a boot enchantment if they brought those back.  +100hp, 20% tenacity, 20% displacement resist, -10ms or something like that seems like it would fit the theme

What does the "-30% effectiveness for displacements" do?

Does Blitz yank you in that much faster? Or won't he get you close enough for that follow-up knockup? Either way, I say it would be broken; One for benefit of the Blitz team, one for the benefit of the opponent. I don't think there can be such an effect to counteract displacement effects.

edit; also, animations would have to be changed for that and it would be too heavy task for Riot to undertake.
